intro: Pholidota triotos, commonly known as the three-toothed pholidota, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive three-lobed shape, contributing to its common name. The species is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
